definitions: Compensate for the faults or bad aspects of.
Do something that compensates for poor past performance or behaviour.
Atone or make amends for (sin, error, or evil)
Save (someone) from sin, error, or evil.
Gain or regain possession of (something) in exchange for payment.
Repay (a stock, bond, or other instrument) at the maturity date.
Exchange (a coupon, voucher, or trading stamp) for goods, a discount, or money.
Pay the necessary money to clear (a debt)
Free (oneself or another) from slavery or captivity by paying a ransom.
Fulfil or carry out (a pledge or promise)
